This is a simple linear proof

::: {.lproof} :::

    1.       $P$                       [Premise]
    2.       $(P \vee R)\rightarrow Q$ [Premise]
    3.       $P\vee R$                 [Weakening: 1]
    $n$.       $Q$                     [Modus Ponens: 2, 3]
    $n$ + 1. $R$                       [Modus Ponens: 2, $n$]

:::

This is a simple linear proof in math mode

::: {.lproof .as-math} :::
    
    1. P                       [Premise]
    2. (P \vee R)\rightarrow Q [Premise]
    3. P\vee R                 [Weakening: 1]
    4. Q                       [Modus Ponens: 2, 3]

:::

This is a Fitch-style proof

::: {.lproof} :::

    1. |_ $P \rightarrow Q$   
    2. | |_ $\neg Q$
    3. | | |_ $P$  
    4. | | |  $Q$    [Hypothesis: 1, 3]
    5. | | |  $\bot$ [Modus Ponens: 2, 4]
    6. | | $\neg P$      [$\neg E$: 3-5]
    7. | $\neg Q \rightarrow \neg P$  [$\rightarrow I$: 2-6]

:::
